answers.question_text: How is customer data encrypted at rest?
answers.answer: Customer data at rest is encrypted using AES-256 encryption. Encryption keys are managed through AWS KMS (Key Management Service) with a 90-day rotation policy. Database backups are also encrypted and stored in separate regions. Additionally, field-level encryption is implemented specifically for PII (Personally Identifiable Information) data.

answers.question_text: What access control mechanisms are in place?
answers.answer: Our organization implements a comprehensive access control framework based on the following mechanisms: 1) Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) deployed across all systems, ensuring users receive permissions appropriate to their organizational roles. 2) Mandatory Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for all user access, providing an additional layer of security beyond passwords. 3) A formal approval process for privileged access, requiring manager authorization before elevated permissions are granted. 4) Complete logging and monitoring of all access activities through our Splunk SIEM platform, enabling real-time detection and forensic analysis. 5) Implementation of a zero-trust architecture, which assumes no implicit trust and continuously validates access requests regardless of their origin.

answers.answer: Our organization maintains the following compliance certifications: SOC 2 Type II (with annual audits), ISO 27001:2022 certification, GDPR compliance for EU data processing, and HIPAA compliance with a Business Associate Agreement (BAA) available upon request.
